intro: Diuroglossum rufescens, commonly known as the red-flowered bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red, often with a contrasting throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
